title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0355

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine, and today we're tackling a very difficult issue for many English learners.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们要讨论一个对许多英语学习者来说非常困难的问题。

segments.en: We're talking about taking things from other people and giving them back.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论从别人那里借东西并归还。

segments.en: That's right.
So today we are going to talk about money, and we're going to lend money and borrow money, and we're going to talk more about this after we listen to the dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们要谈论钱，我们要借钱和还钱，听完对话后我们会进一步讨论。

segments.en: Can I borrow five bucks?
No.
Come on, I'll pay you back on Tuesday.
Last time I lent you money, you never paid me back.
segments.cn: 上次我借你钱，你从未还我。

segments.en: I promise, if you lend me five dollars today, I will repay you in full next week.
segments.cn: 我保证，如果你今天借我五美元，我下周会全额还你。

segments.en: Okay, but I'm taking your skateboard as collateral.
segments.cn: 好吧，但我会把你的滑板车作为抵押。

segments.en: Fine.
I can't believe you don't trust me.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信你不信任我。

segments.en: It's nothing personal, just business.
segments.cn: 这不是个人问题，只是商业。

segments.en: All right, so now let's take a look at that language on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在让我们看看Language Takeaway上的语言。

segments.en: So first up, we have the key verbs for today.
segments.cn: 首先，我们有今天的关键动词。

segments.en: The verb to borrow and to lend.
Now, this is a really important difference to make because many people make this mistake where they use the wrong verb.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常重要的区别，因为很多人会犯这个错误，使用错误的动词。

segments.en: Now, if I ask you, Marco, can I borrow your bicycle?
segments.cn: 现在，如果我问你，Marco，我可以借你的自行车吗？

segments.en: That means, can I take your bicycle from you?
segments.cn: 这意味着，我可以从你那里拿走你的自行车吗？

segments.en: And then later I'll give it back.
But I want to use it.
Right.
So the verb is kind of reflexive.
segments.cn: 所以这个动词有点反身。

segments.en: It's going on to you.
So you want to borrow, right?
I want to borrow.
I want to take it from you for a short time and then I want to give it back.
segments.cn: 我想短时间内从你那里拿走，然后再还给你。

segments.en: So to borrow.
Right.
Now the other verb is to lend.
And that, on the other hand, goes from me to you.
So you borrow my bicycle.
I lend you my bicycle.
I give it to you.
That's right.
So another way of asking, can I borrow, is can you lend me your bike?
segments.cn: 所以问“我可以借吗”的另一种方式是“你可以借我你的自行车吗？”

segments.en: That means, can you act?
segments.cn: 这意味着，你能帮我这个忙吗？

segments.en: Can you do this thing for me?
So there's two different ways of saying it.
segments.cn: 所以有两种不同的说法。

segments.en: And it's very important to remember who is doing what.
segments.cn: 记住谁在做什么是非常重要的。

segments.en: Exactly.
So remember, the person taking is borrowing.
The person giving is lending.
So it's not correct.
segments.cn: 所以说“你能借我你的自行车吗”是不正确的。

segments.en: And remember, and it's not correct to say, can you borrow me your bicycle?
That's not right.
Like, can you lend me a hand?
segments.cn: 比如，你能借我一只手吗？

segments.en: Can you help me?
Right.
So remember this.
To borrow is something I do.
I want to borrow from you.
It's the person, the subject in a sentence.
But in the case of lending, someone else is doing it.
segments.cn: 但在贷的情况下，是别人做的。

segments.en: So can you lend to me?
Or can you lend it to him?
You have to say who it's being lent to.
Exactly.
And as you said, who it's being lent to.
So the past tense of lend is lent.
Yeah, so Marco lent me his bike last week and I broke it.
segments.cn: 是的，Marco上周借了我他的自行车，我把它弄坏了。

segments.en: So now I have to pay him a lot of money.
segments.cn: 所以现在我得给他很多钱。

segments.en: You have to pay me five bucks.
And that's our next word.
segments.cn: 这就是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: Bucks.
Now this is a slang term.
So this is something we say very casually in America when we want to talk about dollars.
segments.cn: 这是我们在美国非常随意地谈论美元时使用的。

segments.en: Right.
So one buck is one dollar.
A hundred bucks is a hundred dollars.
Alright.
Now as you said, it's very American.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，这非常美国。

segments.en: You wouldn't really use it like, I don't know if you're in Britain, you wouldn't say a hundred bucks.
segments.cn: 如果你在英国，你不会说一百块。

segments.en: No, you would say quid.
Quid.
Yeah, exactly.
So they don't have dollars, so they don't say bucks.
segments.cn: 所以他们没有美元，所以他们不说bucks。

segments.en: Not in England.
Alright, very good.
So we wanted to borrow five dollars.
And that person promised to pay you back on Tuesday.
segments.cn: 那个人承诺星期二还你。

segments.en: I'll pay you back on Tuesday.
Alright, so this is a lot like that verb to lend.
segments.cn: 好的，这与贷这个动词非常相似。

segments.en: To lend him, to pay you, you have to say who you're going to pay.
segments.cn: 借给他，付给你，你必须说你要付给谁。

segments.en: Right.
So Marco, I'm sorry about your bicycle.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，我为你的自行车感到抱歉。

segments.en: I will pay you back tomorrow.
Okay.
That means I will give you money for it tomorrow.
segments.cn: 这意味着我明天会给你钱。

segments.en: So if you borrow money, you have to pay it back.
segments.cn: 所以如果你借钱，你必须还。

segments.en: Alright, so I want to borrow five dollars.
I promise I will pay you back Thursday.
segments.cn: 我保证我星期四会还你。

segments.en: Very good.
Okay.
And now lastly, we will lend money, but of course we need a guarantee.
segments.cn: 最后，我们会借钱，但当然我们需要一个保证。

segments.en: We need something to make sure that you will pay me back.
segments.cn: 我们需要一些东西来确保你会还我。

segments.en: So that's called collateral.
Alright, now collateral is important because sometimes you can't trust someone like you say, Marco.
segments.cn: 好的，抵押物很重要，因为有时候你不能信任某人，就像你说的，Marco。

segments.en: And so for example, if I want to rent a bicycle, so I want to use it for the day, maybe there's a store that they rent bicycles to people, I would give my passport or my driver's license as collateral because I will definitely return to take my driver's license or passport back.
segments.cn: 例如，如果我想租一辆自行车，想用一天，也许有一家店租自行车给人，我会把我的护照或驾照作为抵押，因为我肯定会回来取回我的驾照或护照。

segments.en: So that's basically a sign of a promise.
segments.cn: 所以这基本上是一个承诺的标志。

segments.en: Money or identification or some object.
segments.cn: 钱或身份证明或某个物品。

segments.en: That's right.
So usually, for example, if you're going to get a very big loan at the bank, they will ask you for something as collateral.
segments.cn: 通常，例如，如果你要在银行获得一笔很大的贷款，他们会要求你提供一些抵押物。

segments.en: So maybe you will have to give them your house as collateral.
segments.cn: 所以也许你需要把你的房子作为抵押。

segments.en: So you're saying if I can't pay you back, then you can take my house.
segments.cn: 所以你是在说如果我不能还你钱，那么你可以拿我的房子。

segments.en: That's right.
So collateral is the last word in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以抵押物是语言学习中的最后一个词。

segments.en: But we do have some great phrases for you coming up in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 但我们接下来会有一些很棒的短语在流利表达中给你。

segments.en: Can I borrow five bucks?
No.
Come on.
I'll pay you back on Tuesday.
Last time I lent you money, you never paid me back.
segments.cn: 上次我借给你钱，你从来没有还我。

segments.en: I promise if you lend me five dollars today, I will repay you in full next week.
segments.cn: 我保证如果你今天借我五美元，我下周会全额还你。

segments.en: Okay.
But I'm taking your skateboard as collateral.
segments.cn: 但我会把你的滑板作为抵押。

segments.en: Fine.
I can't believe you don't trust me.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信你不信任我。

segments.en: It's nothing personal.
Just business.
All right, we're back.
So let's take a look at these phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看流利表达中的这些短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder So Marco, these are two friends talking and the way they talk to each other is very casual, right?
segments.cn: 流利表达 所以Marco，这两个朋友在交谈，他们的交流方式非常随意，对吧？

segments.en: So we hear at the beginning, can I borrow five bucks?
segments.cn: 一开始我们听到，可以借我五块钱吗？

segments.en: No.
Come on.
Right.
So what is this come on?
segments.cn: 那么这个“拜托”是什么意思？

segments.en: It's a persuasive phrase.
It's one of those phrases where you're trying to convince or persuade people.
segments.cn: 这是你试图说服或劝说别人的短语之一。

segments.en: And you can use it as an interjection in many situations.
segments.cn: 你可以在许多情况下将其用作感叹词。

segments.en: So, for example, here, come on, lend it to me.
segments.cn: 例如，在这里，拜托，借给我。

segments.en: Lend me some money.
I'll pay you back.
You're trying to convince that person.
segments.cn: 你是在试图说服那个人。

segments.en: Please.
Exactly.
But what about this situation?
I'm running late.
I have to go.
And my friend, she's still sitting at her desk, maybe at work, and it's taking forever.
segments.cn: 而我的朋友，她还坐在她的桌子旁，也许在工作，花了很长时间。

segments.en: I say, come on, let's go.
Right.
It's like, hurry up, move it.
All right.
So it's a way of getting someone to do something.
segments.cn: 所以这是让某人做某事的一种方式。

segments.en: You want them to follow you.
Exactly.
And now talking about money again, the person promised to repay the money.
segments.cn: 现在再谈谈钱，这个人承诺会还钱。

segments.en: He said, I'll pay you back on Tuesday.
But then he also said, I will repay you in full next week.
segments.cn: 但他也说，我下周会全额还你。

segments.en: In full.
Now, remember, this is important.
I will repay you in full.
That means I won't repay you a little bit.
segments.cn: 这意味着我不会只还你一点。

segments.en: And then a little bit later, I will repay you everything next week.
segments.cn: 然后稍后我会下周还你所有的钱。

segments.en: Right.
Exactly.
So if you have to pay or repay someone in full, you have to give them the entire amount, not just a part of it.
segments.cn: 所以如果你必须全额支付或偿还某人，你必须给他们全部金额，而不仅仅是部分。

segments.en: That's right.
In full.
Full means everything.
And the final phrase is the very last line of today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 最后一个短语是今天对话的最后一句话。

segments.en: It's nothing personal.
It's just business.
I think this is a common phrase that people use when maybe doing business with friends or people you know.
segments.cn: 我认为这是人们在与朋友或熟人做生意时常用的短语。

segments.en: Maybe you're asking for collateral and the guy's like, I can't believe you don't trust me.
segments.cn: 也许你在要求抵押物，而那个人说，我真不敢相信你不信任我。

segments.en: And I'm your brother.
And he's like, it's nothing personal.
segments.cn: 他就说，这不是个人问题。

segments.en: It's just business.
It's a way to say, listen, this is not about you and me.
segments.cn: 这是一种说法，听着，这不是关于你和我的事。

segments.en: This is about my rules.
And when I give something to someone, I always ask for collateral.
segments.cn: 当我把东西给某人时，我总是要求抵押。

segments.en: So it's just business.
It's just my way of doing this.
Exactly.
So it's a good phrase to use if you're doing maybe business with a friend.
segments.cn: 所以如果你和朋友做生意时，这是一个很好的短语。

segments.en: And you say, hey, it's nothing personal.
segments.cn: 你可以说，嘿，这不是个人问题。

segments.en: It's just business.
Nothing personal.
So that's the last phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这是最后一个短语。

segments.en: Let's take a listen to the dialogue again and we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍对话，我们马上回来。

segments.en: Can I borrow five bucks?
No.
Come on.
I'll pay you back on Tuesday.
Last time I lent you money, you never paid me back.
segments.cn: 上次我借给你钱，你从来没有还我。

segments.en: I promise if you lend me five dollars today, I will repay you in full next week.
segments.cn: 我保证如果你今天借我五美元，我下周会全额还你。

segments.en: Okay.
But I'm taking your skateboard as collateral.
segments.cn: 但我会把你的滑板作为抵押。

segments.en: Fine.
I can't believe you don't trust me.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信你不信任我。

segments.en: It's nothing personal.
Just business.
All right.
So lending money, borrowing money.
Now, as we mentioned, sometimes you have people that ask you for money.
segments.cn: 现在，正如我们提到的，有时你会遇到向你要钱的人。

segments.en: Now, did you ever have that friend that always asks you for money and never repaid you?
segments.cn: 你有没有那种朋友，总是向你借钱却从不还？

segments.en: Yes.
Like a dollar at a time.
Hey, can I borrow a dollar?
Can I borrow five dollars?
Yeah, always.
And actually this friend, he would borrow ten dollars and he would say, oh, I'll buy you a coffee tomorrow.
segments.cn: 其实这个朋友，他会借十美元，然后说，哦，我明天请你喝咖啡。

segments.en: I say, what, a ten dollar coffee?
segments.cn: 我说，什么，十美元的咖啡？

segments.en: I don't think so.
So it was always uneven.
I paid more and he never repaid me in full.
segments.cn: 我付得更多，他从未全额还我。

segments.en: Yeah.
And actually, I think if you add up all those little amount of money that maybe some friends borrowed from you, it would be quite a decent amount.
segments.cn: 其实，我觉得如果你把那些朋友向你借的所有小金额加起来，那会是相当可观的数目。

segments.en: I had many friends who would be like, hey, can I borrow a dollar or even like 25 cents at a time.
segments.cn: 我有很多朋友会说，嘿，我可以借一美元，甚至一次借25美分。

segments.en: It would add up over time.
segments.cn: 随着时间的推移，这些会累积起来。

segments.en: After a couple of years?
Yeah, that's like a whole dinner.
segments.cn: 是的，那就像一顿完整的晚餐。

segments.en: Exactly.
So what do you call these people?
segments.cn: 那么你怎么称呼这些人？

segments.en: The word in English that's a slang word is called a mooch.
A mooch, right.
He's a mooch.
It means he's always taking money from people or asking other people to pay for his dinner or staying at someone's house.
segments.cn: 这意味着他总是向别人要钱，或者让别人为他的晚餐买单，或者住在别人家里。

segments.en: So a mooch is someone who tries to get things for free.
segments.cn: 所以mooch是指那些试图免费获得东西的人。

segments.en: Right.
That's exactly it.
I had friends like this that would, for food as well, like maybe I brought my lunch.
segments.cn: 我有这样的朋友，他们也会向我要食物，比如我带了午餐。

segments.en: This is in school, obviously.
And they would mooch off me like half my sandwich or half my juice.
segments.cn: 他们会向我要半个三明治或半杯果汁。

segments.en: Can I have some chips?
Can I have some juice?
Exactly.
Yeah, that's mooch behavior.
So that's the verb to mooch off someone.
segments.cn: 所以这是动词mooch off someone。

segments.en: Yeah, to mooch off someone.
But it's also a noun.
He's a mooch.
He's a mooch.
Very interesting stuff.
Maybe you have a friend that was a mooch or maybe even yourself back in the day.
segments.cn: 也许你有一个mooch的朋友，或者甚至是你自己。

segments.en: So let us know how it works in your country.
segments.cn: 所以让我们知道在你们国家是怎么回事。

segments.en: If you lend money to people, family members, do you ask for collateral?
segments.cn: 如果你借钱给人，家人，你会要求抵押吗？

segments.en: Or do you just forget about it?
Let us know.
Our website is EnglishPod.com.
We'll see you guys there.
Bye.
